title: The Vagabond Astronomer
name: The Vagabond Astronomer
description:
A Map by Astrorob

Want to know where I am on a certain night...?

properties.description: Posted by Magnusyi

properties.name: Beach Across From Carlin Ponds Park, Jupiter
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob  This huge expanse of white sand is a great place to just throw down an old blanket and watch meteor showers, count the stars, observe satellites... quite a bit, actually!

properties.name: Coral Cover Park, Tequesta
properties.description: Posted by AstrorobThink of this as Blowing Rocks (which is just up the road a piece) little sibling. There is a fantastic coral and limestone outcrop here; great for snorkeling. But, of course, we\'re talking astronomy here. Good all round observing spot.

properties.name: County Dock & Mandarin Boardwalk
properties.description: Posted by AstrorobCounty Dock & Mandarin BoardwalkOnce upon a time, the St. John\'s River was a thriving waterway, and this dock harkens back to those days. Nice for west and northwesterly views from the boat ramp (but be aware of the tides!), or binocular viewing from the dock itself.

properties.name: Dyer Park, West Palm Beach (On Top Of The Mound!)
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob  Once upon a time, this was a landfill. Now, it\'s a pretty big park with an extensive network of bicycle trails. The mound stands perhaps 7 meters (22 feet) above the park, and is an excellent place to set up or just relax with a pair of binoculars.

properties.name: Griffith Observatory & The Aldrin Planetarium, South Florida Science Museum
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob  Not that I would actually be doing any Vagabonding here; Kind of fond of the place, really (trust me!). The Griffith Observatory is home to a 14" Celestron.

properties.name: Hobe Sound Nature Center, Hobe Sound
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob While not as perfectly suited for astronomy as Jonathan Dickinson State Park, this little facility has enoug space in the parking lot to hold a little event.

properties.name: Jupiter Ridge Nature Park
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob Probably one of the few places left in this area that preserves the sensitive nature of the Florida scrub environment in close proximity to large suburban areas. The parking lot should be ideal for setting up any number of scopes!

properties.name: Losco Regional Park
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob There are a number of soccer fields here, but on nights when they are not in use, this field is pretty good for a lot of astronomy. As with most city parks, it closes at 10PM.

properties.name: Okeeheelee Park, West Palm Beach
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob  This park blows me away! So many places to choose from. Once upon a time, this was a pretty large country club. Now, it is one of the premier parks here. The marker is on a hill overlooking the lake network, an excellent spot.

properties.name: Parking Lot At Books-a-Million
properties.description: Posted by AstrorobThe Parking Lot In Front Of Books-a-MillionTypical suburban mall parking lot... so we\'re limited to planetary and lunar observing most nights. But Books-a-Million is open until 11PM Monday through Saturday, and 9PM on Sundays... good if you want to grab a cup of Joe!

properties.name: Sidewalk & Seawall, Castillo De San Marco
properties.description: Posted by AstrorobA wonderful reminder of Florida\'s heritage, Castillo de San Marco was built in the late 17th century as the main defense for the Spanish settlement. This is a great site for sidewalk astronomy, if only for the ambience.

properties.name: Tennis Courts At Mandarin Park
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob  Since no one really plays tennis there at night (and the place does close at 10 pm), this is an alternate site for viewing. Not as unpleasant to walk on.

properties.name: The Field At Mandarin Park
properties.description: Posted by AstrorobField At Mandarin ParkA bit darker than most of the surrounding area, better for many objects but with a slightly more restricted field of viewing. Park is open until 10pm most nights.

properties.name: Westside Regional Park
properties.description: Posted by Astrorob While there is a small field, this is not a bad place for some observing. At least it gives the folks at NAS a nearby spot.
